primary_phone.purpose: Confirm Phase-1 appeal mailing addresses and issuing authority routing for New York City parking citations.

sections.authority_name: New York City Department of Finance

serves.description: Processes most New York City parking tickets, camera violations, and parking summonses issued by traffic agents, NYPD officers, and other city agencies.

visual_markers: City of New York Parking Violation
how_to_recognize.notes: Violation or notice numbers are 10 digits and appear beside the barcode on the ticket; camera Notice of Liability (NOL) numbers appear in the top right【717975468056129†L181-L188】.

submission_methods.notes: Hearings can be requested online or by mail; in‑person hearings are available at Department of Finance Business Centers such as the Manhattan Business Center at 66 John Street, 2nd Floor【390394324014242†L46-L52】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the Hearings By Mail Unit address for the specific ticket.

verification.verified_source_note: The Hearings By Mail Unit address and mailing instructions are provided on NYC Department of Finance's request‑a‑hearing‑by‑mail page【78749193110264†L49-L54】.

serves.description: Parking summonses issued by NYPD officers within New York City.

how_to_recognize.notes: NYPD summonses typically use a 10‑digit violation number similar to standard NYC parking tickets; tickets may reference NYPD or be handwritten by officers.

submission_methods.notes: NYPD‑issued parking summonses are generally processed by the NYC Department of Finance.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm that NYPD summonses should be contested through the Department of Finance and obtain mailing instructions.

verification.verified_source_note: Need to confirm whether all NYPD parking summonses route to the Department of Finance for Phase‑1 appeals.

serves.description: Parking violations issued on the Queens College campus by the Public Safety department.

how_to_recognize.notes: Tickets are issued on campus only; the violation tag may include a QC prefix and a five‑ or six‑digit number.

method_constraints: Appeals must be filed within 10 days
submission_methods.notes: Faculty, staff, and students must file appeals online through the Queens College portal within 10 days【669297865972665†L655-L670】; visitors may obtain appeal forms at the Main Gate or Public Safety office. Payment or appeals may be mailed to the Office of Public Safety/Security at the address below【669297865972665†L842-L848】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm whether the mailing address above is valid for Phase‑1 parking citation appeals and obtain any additional instructions.

verification.verified_source_note: The Queens College parking page lists the mailing address for violation tags【669297865972665†L842-L848】 and notes that appeals must be filed online within 10 days【669297865972665†L655-L670】; confirmation is needed to ensure this address is appropriate for appeals.

serves.description: Parking violations issued on St. John’s University campuses by the University’s Department of Public Safety.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citations are issued on campus and reference the University’s Parking Services portal.

method_constraints: Appeals must be submitted within five business days
submission_methods.notes: All appeals must be submitted through the University’s T2 Parking Services portal within five business days of the violation【659537075969262†L346-L355】; in‑person and mail submissions are not accepted.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: The University mandates that all parking citation appeals be filed online through the Parking Services portal; no mailing address is provided for appeals【659537075969262†L346-L355】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm that there is no mailing address for Phase‑1 parking citation appeals and verify the online appeal procedure.

verification.verified_source_note: The University’s parking program pamphlet states that all appeals must be submitted through the online Parking Services portal within five business days and that no in‑person payments are accepted【659537075969262†L346-L355】. Additional confirmation is needed.

sections.canonical_section_name: Port Authority NY & NJ – Parking Summons
sections.authority_name: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Police Department

serves.description: Parking summonses issued at Port Authority facilities in New York City, including JFK Airport, LaGuardia Airport, the Port Authority Bus Terminal, the George Washington Bridge Bus Station, and the New York ends of bridges and tunnels.

how_to_recognize.notes: Summonses are issued by Port Authority Police at airports, bus terminals, and bridge facilities.

method_constraints: Use the address printed on the summons
submission_methods.notes: The Port Authority states that each parking summons must be answered to the address printed on the summons and refers violators to NYC.gov/DOF for additional information; a 24‑hour assistance number (311 or 212‑504‑4115) is listed【635829105653310†screenshot】.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: Port Authority instructs violators to use the address provided on their individual summons; no general mailing address for parking summons appeals is available【635829105653310†screenshot】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Obtain the correct mailing address printed on the specific Port Authority summons and confirm any appeal instructions.

verification.verified_source_note: The Port Authority parking summons information page notes that a parking summons is answerable to the address on the summons and provides no centralized appeal address【635829105653310†screenshot】.

blocking_issues: Need confirmation that NYPD parking summonses always route to the NYC Department of Finance for Phase‑1 appeals.
Queens College mailing address may be for payments rather than appeals; confirmation required.
Port Authority summonses do not provide a centralized mailing address; additional guidance may be needed.
known_gaps: Citation ID patterns for campus and Port Authority summonses are based on assumptions due to lack of published formats.
St. John’s University section lacks a mailing address because the university requires online appeals only.
Port Authority section missing general mailing address; summonses instruct violators to use the address printed on the summons.
